trans-unit.source: App icon assets, which appear in a variety of forms throughout the Windows 10 operating system, are the calling cards for your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.
trans-unit.target: App icon assets, which appear in a variety of forms throughout the Windows 10 operating system, are the calling cards for your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.

trans-unit.source: Guidelines for tile and icon assets
trans-unit.target: Guidelines for tile and icon assets

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: App icon assets, which appear in a variety of forms throughout the Windows 10 operating system, are the calling cards for your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.
trans-unit.target: App icon assets, which appear in a variety of forms throughout the Windows 10 operating system, are the calling cards for your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.

trans-unit.source: These guidelines detail where app icon assets appear in the system, and provide in-depth design tips on how to create the most polished icons.
trans-unit.target: These guidelines detail where app icon assets appear in the system, and provide in-depth design tips on how to create the most polished icons.

trans-unit.source: First, a brief overview on adaptive scaling to better understand how scaling works with assets.
trans-unit.target: First, a brief overview on adaptive scaling to better understand how scaling works with assets.

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 introduces an evolution of the existing scaling model.
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 introduces an evolution of the existing scaling model.

trans-unit.source: In addition to scaling vector content, there is a unified set of scale factors that provides a consistent size for UI elements across a variety of screen sizes and display resolutions.
trans-unit.target: In addition to scaling vector content, there is a unified set of scale factors that provides a consistent size for UI elements across a variety of screen sizes and display resolutions.

trans-unit.source: The scale factors are also compatible with the scale factors of other operating systems such as iOS and Android, which makes it easier to share assets between these platforms.
trans-unit.target: The scale factors are also compatible with the scale factors of other operating systems such as iOS and Android, which makes it easier to share assets between these platforms.

trans-unit.source: The Store picks the assets to download based in part of the DPI of the device.
trans-unit.target: The Store picks the assets to download based in part of the DPI of the device.

trans-unit.source: Only the assets that best match the device are downloaded.
trans-unit.target: Only the assets that best match the device are downloaded.

trans-unit.source: The basic components of a Start tile consist of a back plate, an icon, a branding bar, margins, and an app title:
trans-unit.target: The basic components of a Start tile consist of a back plate, an icon, a branding bar, margins, and an app title:

trans-unit.source: The branding bar at the bottom of a tile is where the app name, badging, and counter (if used) appear:
trans-unit.target: The branding bar at the bottom of a tile is where the app name, badging, and counter (if used) appear:

trans-unit.source: The height of the branding bar is based on the scale factor of the device on which it appears:
trans-unit.target: The height of the branding bar is based on the scale factor of the device on which it appears:

trans-unit.source: The system sets tile margins and cannot be modified.
trans-unit.target: The system sets tile margins and cannot be modified.

trans-unit.source: Most content appears inside the margins, as seen in this example:
trans-unit.target: Most content appears inside the margins, as seen in this example:

trans-unit.source: Margin width is based on the scale factor of the device on which it appears:
trans-unit.target: Margin width is based on the scale factor of the device on which it appears:

trans-unit.source: Each tile asset is the same size as the tile on which it is placed.
trans-unit.target: Each tile asset is the same size as the tile on which it is placed.

trans-unit.source: You can brand your app's tiles with two different representations of an asset:
trans-unit.target: You can brand your app's tiles with two different representations of an asset:

trans-unit.source: An icon or logo centered with padding.
trans-unit.target: An icon or logo centered with padding.

trans-unit.source: This lets the back plate color show through:
trans-unit.target: This lets the back plate color show through:

trans-unit.source: A full-bleed, branded tile without padding:
trans-unit.target: A full-bleed, branded tile without padding:

trans-unit.source: For consistency across devices, each tile size (small, medium, wide, and large) has its own sizing relationship.
trans-unit.target: For consistency across devices, each tile size (small, medium, wide, and large) has its own sizing relationship.

trans-unit.source: In order to achieve a consistent icon placement across tiles, we recommend a few basic padding guidelines for the following tile sizes.
trans-unit.target: In order to achieve a consistent icon placement across tiles, we recommend a few basic padding guidelines for the following tile sizes.

trans-unit.source: The area where the two purple overlays intersect represents the ideal footprint for an icon.
trans-unit.target: The area where the two purple overlays intersect represents the ideal footprint for an icon.

trans-unit.source: Although icons won't always fit inside the footprint, the visual volume of an icon should be roughly equivalent to the provided examples.
trans-unit.target: Although icons won't always fit inside the footprint, the visual volume of an icon should be roughly equivalent to the provided examples.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the icon is too large for the tile:
trans-unit.target: In this example, the icon is too large for the tile:

trans-unit.source: In this example, the icon is too small for the tile:
trans-unit.target: In this example, the icon is too small for the tile:

trans-unit.source: The following padding ratios are optimal for horizontally or vertically oriented icons.
trans-unit.target: The following padding ratios are optimal for horizontally or vertically oriented icons.

trans-unit.source: For small tiles, limit the icon width and height to 66% of the tile size:
trans-unit.target: For small tiles, limit the icon width and height to 66% of the tile size:

trans-unit.source: For medium tiles, limit the icon width to 66% and height to 50% of tile size.
trans-unit.target: For medium tiles, limit the icon width to 66% and height to 50% of tile size.

trans-unit.source: This prevents overlapping of elements in the branding bar:
trans-unit.target: This prevents overlapping of elements in the branding bar:

trans-unit.source: For wide tiles, limit the icon width to 66% and height to 50% of tile size.
trans-unit.target: For wide tiles, limit the icon width to 66% and height to 50% of tile size.

trans-unit.source: This prevents overlapping of elements in the branding bar:
trans-unit.target: This prevents overlapping of elements in the branding bar:

trans-unit.source: For large tiles, limit the icon width and height to 50% of tile size:
trans-unit.target: For large tiles, limit the icon width and height to 50% of tile size:

trans-unit.source: Some icons are designed to be horizontally or vertically oriented, while others have more complex shapes that prevent them from fitting squarely within the target dimensions.
trans-unit.target: Some icons are designed to be horizontally or vertically oriented, while others have more complex shapes that prevent them from fitting squarely within the target dimensions.

trans-unit.source: Icons that appear to be centered can be weighted to one side.
trans-unit.target: Icons that appear to be centered can be weighted to one side.

trans-unit.source: In this case, parts of an icon may hang outside the recommended footprint, provided it occupies the same visual weight as a squarely fitted icon:
trans-unit.target: In this case, parts of an icon may hang outside the recommended footprint, provided it occupies the same visual weight as a squarely fitted icon:

trans-unit.source: With full-bleed assets, take into account elements that interact within the margins and edges of the tiles.
trans-unit.target: With full-bleed assets, take into account elements that interact within the margins and edges of the tiles.

trans-unit.source: Maintain margins of at least 16% of the height or width of the tile.
trans-unit.target: Maintain margins of at least 16% of the height or width of the tile.

trans-unit.source: This percentage represents double the width of the margins at the smallest tile sizes:
trans-unit.target: This percentage represents double the width of the margins at the smallest tile sizes:

trans-unit.source: In this example, margins are too tight:
trans-unit.target: In this example, margins are too tight:

trans-unit.source: full bleed tile with margins that are too small
trans-unit.target: full bleed tile with margins that are too small

trans-unit.source: Tiles can also appear in a list view.
trans-unit.target: Tiles can also appear in a list view.

trans-unit.source: Sizing guidelines for tile assets that appear in list views are a bit different than tile assets previously outlined.
trans-unit.target: Sizing guidelines for tile assets that appear in list views are a bit different than tile assets previously outlined.

trans-unit.source: This section details those sizing specifics.
trans-unit.target: This section details those sizing specifics.

trans-unit.source: tile assets in a list view
trans-unit.target: tile assets in a list view

trans-unit.source: Limit icon width and height to 75% of the tile size:
trans-unit.target: Limit icon width and height to 75% of the tile size:

trans-unit.source: sizing of icon of list view tile
trans-unit.target: sizing of icon of list view tile

trans-unit.source: For vertical and horizontal icon formats, limit width and height to 75% of the tile size:
trans-unit.target: For vertical and horizontal icon formats, limit width and height to 75% of the tile size:

trans-unit.source: sizing of icon of list view tile
trans-unit.target: sizing of icon of list view tile

trans-unit.source: For full bleed artwork of important brand elements, maintain margins of at least 12.5%:
trans-unit.target: For full bleed artwork of important brand elements, maintain margins of at least 12.5%:

trans-unit.source: full-bleed artwork in list view tile
trans-unit.target: full-bleed artwork in list view tile

trans-unit.source: In this example, the icon is too big inside its tile:
trans-unit.target: In this example, the icon is too big inside its tile:

trans-unit.source: icon that is too big for tile
trans-unit.target: icon that is too big for tile

trans-unit.source: In this example, the icon is too small inside its tile:
trans-unit.target: In this example, the icon is too small inside its tile:

trans-unit.source: icon that is too small for tile
trans-unit.target: icon that is too small for tile

trans-unit.source: Target-based assets are for icons and tiles that appear on the Windows taskbar, task view, ALT+TAB, snap-assist, and the lower-right corner of Start tiles.
trans-unit.target: Target-based assets are for icons and tiles that appear on the Windows taskbar, task view, ALT+TAB, snap-assist, and the lower-right corner of Start tiles.

trans-unit.source: You don't have to add padding to these assets; Windows adds padding if needed.
trans-unit.target: You don't have to add padding to these assets; Windows adds padding if needed.

trans-unit.source: These assets should account for a minimum footprint of 16 pixels.
trans-unit.target: These assets should account for a minimum footprint of 16 pixels.

trans-unit.source: Here's an example of these assets as they appear in icons on the Windows taskbar:
trans-unit.target: Here's an example of these assets as they appear in icons on the Windows taskbar:

trans-unit.source: Although these UI will use a target-based asset on top of a colored backplate by default, you may use a target-based unplated asset as well.
trans-unit.target: Although these UI will use a target-based asset on top of a colored backplate by default, you may use a target-based unplated asset as well.

trans-unit.source: Unplated assets should be created with the possibility that they may appear on various background colors:
trans-unit.target: Unplated assets should be created with the possibility that they may appear on various background colors:

trans-unit.source: These are size recommendations for target-based assets, at 100% scale:
trans-unit.target: These are size recommendations for target-based assets, at 100% scale:

trans-unit.source: The iconic template (also known as the "IconWithBadge" template) lets you display a small image in the center of the tile.
trans-unit.target: The iconic template (also known as the "IconWithBadge" template) lets you display a small image in the center of the tile.

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 supports the template on both phone and tablet/desktop.
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 supports the template on both phone and tablet/desktop.

trans-unit.source: (Learn about creating iconic tiles in the [Special tile templates article](tiles-and-notifications-special-tile-templates-catalog.md).)
trans-unit.target: (Learn about creating iconic tiles in the [Special tile templates article](tiles-and-notifications-special-tile-templates-catalog.md).)

trans-unit.source: Apps that use the iconic template, such as Messaging, Phone, and Store, have target-based assets that can feature a badge (with the live counter).
trans-unit.target: Apps that use the iconic template, such as Messaging, Phone, and Store, have target-based assets that can feature a badge (with the live counter).

trans-unit.source: As with other target-based assets, no padding is needed.
trans-unit.target: As with other target-based assets, no padding is needed.

trans-unit.source: Iconic assets aren't part of the app manifest, but are part of a live tile payload.
trans-unit.target: Iconic assets aren't part of the app manifest, but are part of a live tile payload.

trans-unit.source: Assets are scaled to fit and centered within a 3:2 ratio container:
trans-unit.target: Assets are scaled to fit and centered within a 3:2 ratio container:

trans-unit.source: sizing for assets with and without badge
trans-unit.target: sizing for assets with and without badge

trans-unit.source: For square assets, automatic centering within the container occurs:
trans-unit.target: For square assets, automatic centering within the container occurs:

trans-unit.source: square asset sizing, with and without badge
trans-unit.target: square asset sizing, with and without badge

trans-unit.source: For non-square assets, automatic horizontal/vertical centering and snapping to the width/height of the container occurs:
trans-unit.target: For non-square assets, automatic horizontal/vertical centering and snapping to the width/height of the container occurs:

trans-unit.source: non-square asset sizing, with and without badge
trans-unit.target: non-square asset sizing, with and without badge

trans-unit.source: non-square asset sizing, with and without badge
trans-unit.target: non-square asset sizing, with and without badge

trans-unit.source: The splash screen image can be given either as a direct path to an image file or as a resource.
trans-unit.target: The splash screen image can be given either as a direct path to an image file or as a resource.

trans-unit.source: By using a resource reference, you can supply images of different scales so that Windows can choose the best size for the device and screen resolution.
trans-unit.target: By using a resource reference, you can supply images of different scales so that Windows can choose the best size for the device and screen resolution.

trans-unit.source: You can also supply high contrast images for accessibility and localized images to match different UI languages.
trans-unit.target: You can also supply high contrast images for accessibility and localized images to match different UI languages.

trans-unit.source: If you open "Package.appxmanifest" in a text editor, the [**SplashScreen**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211467) element appears as a child of the [**VisualElements**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211471) element.
trans-unit.target: If you open "Package.appxmanifest" in a text editor, the [**SplashScreen**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211467) element appears as a child of the [**VisualElements**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211471) element.

trans-unit.source: The default splash screen markup in the manifest file looks like this in a text editor:
trans-unit.target: The default splash screen markup in the manifest file looks like this in a text editor:

trans-unit.source: The splash screen asset is centered by whichever device it appears on:
trans-unit.target: The splash screen asset is centered by whichever device it appears on:

trans-unit.source: High-contrast mode makes use of separate sets of assets for high-contrast white (white background with black text) and high-contrast black (black background with white text).
trans-unit.target: High-contrast mode makes use of separate sets of assets for high-contrast white (white background with black text) and high-contrast black (black background with white text).

trans-unit.source: If you don't provide high-contrast assets for your app, standard assets will be used.
trans-unit.target: If you don't provide high-contrast assets for your app, standard assets will be used.

trans-unit.source: If your app's standard assets provide an acceptable viewing experience when rendered on a black-and-white background, then your app should look at least satisfactory in high-contrast mode.
trans-unit.target: If your app's standard assets provide an acceptable viewing experience when rendered on a black-and-white background, then your app should look at least satisfactory in high-contrast mode.

trans-unit.source: If your standard assets don't afford an acceptable viewing experience when rendered on a black-and-white background, consider specifically including high-contrast assets.
trans-unit.target: If your standard assets don't afford an acceptable viewing experience when rendered on a black-and-white background, consider specifically including high-contrast assets.

trans-unit.source: These examples illustrate the two types of high-contrast assets:
trans-unit.target: These examples illustrate the two types of high-contrast assets:

trans-unit.source: If you decide to provide high-contrast assets, you need to include both sets—both white-on-black and black-on-white.
trans-unit.target: If you decide to provide high-contrast assets, you need to include both sets—both white-on-black and black-on-white.

trans-unit.source: When including these assets in your package, you could create a "contrast-black" folder for white-on-black assets, and a "contrast-white" folder for black-on-white assets.
trans-unit.target: When including these assets in your package, you could create a "contrast-black" folder for white-on-black assets, and a "contrast-white" folder for black-on-white assets.

trans-unit.source: At a bare minimum, we strongly recommend that you provide assets for the 100, 200, and 400 scale factors.
trans-unit.target: At a bare minimum, we strongly recommend that you provide assets for the 100, 200, and 400 scale factors.

trans-unit.source: Providing assets for all scale factors will provide the optimal user experience.
trans-unit.target: Providing assets for all scale factors will provide the optimal user experience.

trans-unit.source: File name examples for scale-based assets
trans-unit.target: File name examples for scale-based assets

trans-unit.source: Target-based assets are used across multiple scale factors.
trans-unit.target: Target-based assets are used across multiple scale factors.

trans-unit.source: The element name for target-based assets is **Square44x44Logo**.
trans-unit.target: The element name for target-based assets is **Square44x44Logo**.

trans-unit.source: We strongly recommend submitting the following assets as a bare minimum:
trans-unit.target: We strongly recommend submitting the following assets as a bare minimum:

trans-unit.source: The following table lists all target-based asset sizes and corresponding file name examples:
trans-unit.target: The following table lists all target-based asset sizes and corresponding file name examples:

trans-unit.source: \* Submit these asset sizes as a baseline
trans-unit.target: \* Submit these asset sizes as a baseline

trans-unit.source: Listed here are all asset types, their uses, and recommended file names.
trans-unit.target: Listed here are all asset types, their uses, and recommended file names.

trans-unit.source: Centered assets are generally used on the Start to showcase your app.
trans-unit.target: Centered assets are generally used on the Start to showcase your app.

trans-unit.source: These assets are used on surfaces that request scale factors.
trans-unit.target: These assets are used on surfaces that request scale factors.

trans-unit.source: Assets either get plated by the system or come with their own background color if the app includes that.
trans-unit.target: Assets either get plated by the system or come with their own background color if the app includes that.

trans-unit.source: These are fixed asset sizes that don't scale with plateaus.
trans-unit.target: These are fixed asset sizes that don't scale with plateaus.

trans-unit.source: Assets are checked by the system.
trans-unit.target: Assets are checked by the system.

trans-unit.source: These are assets that don't get plated or scaled by the system.
trans-unit.target: These are assets that don't get plated or scaled by the system.

trans-unit.source: These are assets specific to file extensions.
trans-unit.target: These are assets specific to file extensions.

trans-unit.source: They appear next to Win32-style file association icons in File Explorer and must be theme-agnostic.
trans-unit.target: They appear next to Win32-style file association icons in File Explorer and must be theme-agnostic.

trans-unit.source: Sizing is different on desktop and mobile platforms.
trans-unit.target: Sizing is different on desktop and mobile platforms.

trans-unit.source: Impacted apps: Music, Video, Photos, Microsoft Edge, Microsoft Office
trans-unit.target: Impacted apps: Music, Video, Photos, Microsoft Edge, Microsoft Office

trans-unit.source: The asset that appears on your app's splash screen.
trans-unit.target: The asset that appears on your app's splash screen.

trans-unit.source: Automatically scales on both desktop and mobile platforms.
trans-unit.target: Automatically scales on both desktop and mobile platforms.

trans-unit.source: These are assets for apps that make use of the iconic template.
trans-unit.target: These are assets for apps that make use of the iconic template.

trans-unit.source: Impacted apps: Messaging, Phone, Store, more
trans-unit.target: Impacted apps: Messaging, Phone, Store, more

trans-unit.source: \[This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.
